newsitem.title: SLOVENIA: BASKETBALL-LJUBLJANA BEAT MILAN 73-69 TO SET UP DECIDER.
newsitem.headline: BASKETBALL-LJUBLJANA BEAT MILAN 73-69 TO SET UP DECIDER.

text.p: Olimpija from Ljubljana beat Italy's Stefanel Milan 73-69 in the second leg of the men's EuroLeague championship quarter-final on Tuesday to set up a third leg decider in Milan on Thursday.
Milan won the first leg last week 94-90 against a team generally thought to have one of the best defences around.
On Tuesday, they lived up more to that reputation, relinquishing the ball only eight times, compared to 20 by the Italian club.
Olimpija's top scorer was Aeriel McDonald with 14 points, while Warren Kidd led Stefanel with 24, but to no avail.
Over 4,500 packed the indoor arena to cheer their local heroes with hundreds more outside watching on a large TV screen.
